thread.title: Louis van Gaal lined up for a shock return to management with Holland for a third time
thread.title_full: Louis van Gaal lined up for a shock return to management with Holland for a third time

author: rforrester
title: Louis van Gaal lined up for a shock return to management with Holland for a third time

persons.name: richard forrester comments louis van gaal

text:
Third time lucky Louis van Gaal lined up for a shock return to management with Holland for a third time 
Ex-Manchester United boss could replace Danny Blind after he was sacked late on Sunday By Richard Forrester Comments LOUIS VAN GAAL could be making a sensational return to management with Holland. Louis van Gaal took Holland to the World Cup final in 2014 
The result leaves the three-time runners-up struggling to qualify for their second major tournament in succession. 
Keep up to date with ALL the football news, gossip, transfers and goals on our page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary. 
And the ex-Manchester United manager is sensationally being lined up to steady the ship for a third time in his career. 
Van Gaal impressed in his second spell, guiding a mediocre Dutch team to the semi-finals of the 2014 World Cup in Brazil before joining the Red Devils. 4 It will be his third time managing Holland if is he appointed manager 
But he has been without a club since he was sacked in May last year and initially stated his intention to retire unless he was offered an attractive proposal. 
If Van Gaal is offered the job, he has work ahead with Holland fourth place in their qualifying table, some six points behind leaders France and three behind second-placed Sweden. AP:Associated Press Time has been called on Danny Blind’s time in charge of Holland most read Not good enough Antonio Conte has sensationally rejected the chance to sign Neymar in a £155m deal from Barcelona leg-break horror Seamus Coleman set for surgery on potential career-threatening injury after his leg is snapped in half by Neil Taylor's wild tackle TV TIMES What TV channel is England vs Lithuania on, what time is kick-off and what is the latest team news? LIONHEART Brave Bradley Lowery gets the biggest cheer at Wembley as he leads out the England team with goal hero and best mate Jermain Defoe Seeing Red Keith Gillespie launches viscous elbow into face of opponent during Man United charity match 'We'll talk soon' Mesut Ozil gives clearest indication yet he is set to sign a new deal with Arsenal in the summer Getty Images Ronald Koeman is on the shortlist but he is likely to stay at Everton 
However football director Jean Paul Decossaux admits other names are being considered including Ronald Koeman. 
He told De Telegraaf: “For the profile we’re looking for we have a technical director, but we will also look for many other experts. 
“We hope to come to an agreement with a new coach, but it will not be done in a week. Ahead of the games in June seems to be reasonable. 
“That list should include all kinds of names – a foreign coach is an option. 
“Ronald Koeman is undoubtedly capable, but I know he is under contract with a club. 
“Tomorrow, Dutch football may move forward.” Watch the best of Louis van Gaal's comedy moments during press conferences
